page.title: 10QUESTIONS TO THE LIFEBOATMEN
page.content: {Five crew members}answered our questions. Two are local fishermen: {one,Robert Henry West,}has served for 40 years and his great-grandfather, Robert Cooper, was Coxswain on "The Duncan", Sheringham's first R.N.L.I. Lifeboat (1867-1886) and the {other,John William West,}has served for 39 years.{W.L.Thirtle,}a contract window cleaner,has been in the Service over 20 years and like his four friends used to attend Sheringham C.P.School.{Chris Ayers,a}crew member since 1970, started work with the Service in 1958 as a shore helper. {David Mann,}a plumber, has served for eight years. Among their likes are watching "Question Time" on TV, playing snooker, brass bands, eating lobster and playing cricket. People they admire are Sir Alec Rose, Sir Douglas Bader and Harold MacMillan.
